intro: Krigia virginica, commonly known as the common ragwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in early spring. Krigia virginica is an annual plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
